thread.title: Wind gusts of 50 mph expected in latest Bay Area storm
thread.title_full: Wind gusts of 50 mph expected in latest Bay Area storm - SFGate

author: sfgate.com
title: Wind gusts of 50 mph expected in latest Bay Area storm
text:
Rain is on the way.
Media: MediaOS Video A storm expected to hit the Bay Area Wednesday night could drop up to 1.5 inches of rain around San Francisco through Friday, meteorologists said.
The storm is also expected to whip up gusts of wind as high as 50 mph in exposed areas along the coast and in the hills, and the National Weather Service issued wind advisories through early Friday morning for most locations.
Up to 3 inches of rain are expected in the Santa Cruz Mountains, as well as in the flood-prone North Bay around Marin County, forecasters said. No serious flooding — such as the deluge along the Russian River in Guerneville in early January — is expected. 
A second, and less-defined, storm system could follow the first one early next week, with preliminary rainfall forecasts of 1-3 inches through Monday for that storm, forecasters said.
Michael Bodley is a San Francisco Chronicle staff writer. Email: mbodley@sfchronicle.com . Twitter: @michael_bodley 
Photo: Michael Short, Special To The Chronicle Image 1 of / 16 Caption
